**Note:** The historical period here refers mainly as Late Renaissance Period (Late-Medieval Era) and not Classical Antiquity or High Middle Ages.

Sparta is mentioned directly by name which means it was a location of the story. Grèce/Greece mentions indirectly indicates that Spartans were part of Greece historically speaking; hence this implies France when Lisimacus holds first rank at Pirrhus's court, assuming he rules over both places from Parthia (modern Iran). The play is set in Paris as well because some scenes are said to happen there. Note: A QID was not provided for Sparta or Grèce/Greece but it can be found on Wikidata with the following IDs respectively 2171 and 1195.

The timeframe range given above, covers Late Renaissance Period (Late-Medieval Era) which is a plausible answer in this case based only to its publication date. However since there was no exact period stated for setting of play other than mentioned locations Sparta/Greece/Paris/French etc it does not seem like an easy task nor can be achieved with 100% certainty using just the provided data as per my knowledge cutoff.

**Note:** This is a plausible interpretation based on available information. More accurate or precise answers could potentially require additional context from historical sources, authorial intent analysis (if possible), and cross-references to other known works of Charles-Claude Genest or his contemporaries for more specific clues about the setting which are not provided in this JSON input.

**Note:** Spartans were a real ancient Greek tribe but by 17th century they had been assimilated into Greece. Therefore, Sparta/Greece might refer implicitly that play was set somewhere in France (modern-day Paris), historically speaking as well and could be considered an historical fiction work from the late Renaissance period itself which tries to mimic Ancient Grecian culture through fictional characters.

I hope this clarifies my reasoning behind arriving at these conclusions given what is provided. If there are any further questions please let me know. Thanks!
